descriptionProfile: Birds-of-Paradise Project, Save GP Orangutans, NatGeo Wildlife, BBC Filming, Conservation, Family Adventures... Get inspired to explore nature!
Birds-of-Paradise Project, Save GP Orangutans, NatGeo Wildlife, BBC Filming, Conservation, Family Adventures... Get inspired to explore nature!

posts.description: Photo by @TimLaman.  On our Sierra Nevada backcountry ski trip last week, @RussLaman and I camped near this small lake reflecting the peaks above at sunset.  A few days in the wilderness is good for clearing your head.  It is amazing how you can forget about the outside world while just dealing with the matters at hand like navigation, staying warm, preparing food and water, avoiding avalanches, climbing mountains, and skiing down! #refreshed, #Sierras, #SierraNevada, #backcountryskiing, #California, @thephotosociety, @natgeocreative.

Photo by @TimLaman.  How did you spend Earth Day this past weekend?  I spent it exploring the spectacular wilderness of the Sierra Nevada mountains on a backcountry ski trip with my son @RussLaman, seen here making some well earned turns high in the basin of Big Pine Creek.  The Sierras have had a phenomenal snowfall this season, so there is plenty of snow left for spring skiing if you are willing to climb for it!  #ExploreNature, #Sierras, #SierraNevada, #backcountryskiing, #skiing, #California, @thephotosociety, @natgeocreative.

In honor of Earth Day, my colleagues and I are proud to be included in @natgeocreative’s Flash Sale. Visit the link in my profile to see the full collection of signed prints on sale for $100. Hurry, sale ends tomorrow!
Visit the link in my profile to purchase a signed print of these images and more. I’m excited to be part of @natgeocreative’s Flash Sale in honor of Earth Day, running from April 19th to April 22nd.

Photo by @brianskerry, @stevewinterphoto, @chamiltonjames, and @timlaman.  Signed prints from @natgeocreative photographers are on sale now. Visit the link in my profile to see the full collection of images in honor of Earth Day. Sale ends on April 22nd.

This image of a Bornean orangutan climbing 30 meters up from the canopy of a rainforest in Gunung Palung National Park won the “Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2016” award.  My work aims to shine light on orangutan conservation and the need to protect their rainforest homes.

Purchase signed prints of this image for $100 from April 17th - April 22nd in honor of Earth Day. Click on the link in my profile to see all the signed prints featured in @natgeocreative’s Flash Sale.

Another day at the office for @TimLaman.  I perched on this tree branch with my feet and tripod legs on a small platform that @DrewFulton had rigged up, so I could shoot hornbills feeding at a nearby fig tree.  See the recent post of Rhinoceros Hornbills here and on @NatGeo.  My goal was the elusive and endangered Helmeted Hornbills, but during four mornings at this tree, they never showed up…. That’s the way it goes with wildlife photography some times.  @reddigitalcinema, #Hornbills, #Thailand, @thephotosociety, @natgeocreative.

Photo by @TimLaman.  A Great Hornbill takes off and flies perfectly through an opening in the tree crown on a misty afternoon in the rain forest of Southern Thailand.  @NatGeo photo assistant @DrewFulton and I spent many afternoons at spectacular forest lookouts attempting to capture Helmeted Hornbills, the endangered species that is our main focus.  We had little luck with them, but photographed several other hornbill species like this Great Hornbill found in this rich #rainforest.  Still frame from RED Epic-W camera at 75fps, which allowed me to capture the bird in the exact right position.  @reddigitalcinema, #ShotonRED, #Hornbills, #Thailand, @thephotosociety, @natgeocreative.

Photo by @TimLaman.  Field camp on assignment for @NatGeo in Southern Thailand where we have been searching for Helmeted Hornbills.  @NatGeo team member @DrewFulton and Thailand Hornbill Project team sit down to dinner. Ironically, our campsite high up the mountain in the rain forest is a former illegal logging camp, where the wood left behind forms nice benches, but is a stark reminder that these birds habitat is slowly getting degraded, even in protected areas.  Thailand Hornbill Project is working hard to try to save hornbills across the region.  I’ll share more Behind-the-Scenes shots here over the coming days so you can see what goes into doing the kind of wildlife photography I do.  #Hornbills, #Thailand, @thephotosociety, @natgeocreative

Photo by @TimLaman.  A Rhinoceros Hornbill lets out a call while foraging in a fig tree in Thailand.  I’ve been in the field these recent weeks pursuing the critically endangered Helmeted Hornbill for @NatGeo with @DrewFulton and the team from the Thailand Hornbill Project. Sometimes in wildlife photography, you don’t get what you are after, but some other nice opportunities arise.  I was hoping for Helmeted’s to come to this fig, and spent several mornings in a blind in the canopy, but this Rhinoceros Hornbill showed up instead!  Can’t complain – one of the most awesome birds of SE Asia.  Still frame from RED Epic-W camera.  #Hornbill, #Thailand, #rainforest, @thephotosociety, @natgeocreative, @reddigitalcinema,  #ShotonRED.
